questions.question_text:
An administrator runs an analysis on all workloads using Live Optics and confirms there are a variety of applications, including Microsoft SQL server and Oracle databases. The Microsoft SQL workloads are averaging 4,000 IOPS per virtual machine, approximately 50% writes. The Oracle workloads are averaging 3,000
IOPS per virtual machine, and approximately 80% writes. Which method should be used to input the data into the VMware Cloud on AWS Sizer for the most accurate results?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C all day
While I agree with C, which one passes in the exam? XD
C - Advanced mode you can import Live Optics or RVTools
I agree C is the best answer.

Selected Answer: C
C – There is no 'database mod'e. Quick sizer doesn’t do IOPs or IO. Manual mode with default values wont match IOPs and I/O specified here exactly.

choices.C: Use the Advanced Sizer in 'import' mode. Import the Live Optics data and let the Advanced Sizer set the values for vCPU, vRAM, utilized storage, IOPS and I/ O automatically.
choices.B: Use the Quick Sizer. Set the values for vCPU, vRAM, utilized storage, IOPS and I/O profile manually.
choices.A: Use the Advanced Sizer in 'database' mode. Create workload profiles for the analyzed virtual machines, including profiles for Microsoft SQL and Oracle. Set the values for vCPU, vRAM, utilized storage, IOPS and I/O profile manually.
choices.D: Use the Advanced Sizer in 'manual' mode. Create workload profiles for the analyzed virtual machines, including profiles for Microsoft SQL and Oracle. Use the default values for the SQL and Oracle workload profiles.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC)?

discussion.content: C is the answer
C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
Straight from the training book

Selected Answer: C
C is good

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

C
VMware Cloud on AWS benefits:
VMware SDDC running on AWS bare metal
Delivered, operated, and supported by VMware
On-demand capacity and flexible consumption
Operational consistency with on-premises infrastructure
Large-scale workload portability and hybrid operations 
Global AWS footprint, reach, availability 
Direct access to native AWS services
C is correct

choices.A: It is a VMware environment integrating VMware vCenter Server, VMware vSAN and, optionally, VMware NSX-T that runs on an AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) bare-metal infrastructure and is able to consume native AWS services.
choices.D: It is a VMware environment with VMware vCenter Server, VMware vSAN and VMware NSX-T managing native AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances and able to consume native AWS services.
choices.C: It is a VMware environment integrating VMware vCenter Server, VMware vSAN and VMware NSX-T that runs VMware ESXi on an AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) bare-metal infrastructure and is able to consume native AWS services.
choices.B: It is a VMware environment integrating VMware vCenter Server, VMware vSAN and VMware NSX-T that runs nested VMware ESXi on AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances and is able to consume native AWS services.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Straight forward

Selected Answer: A
+1 A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
A - is correct

Optimize for lowest cost keep the hosts count to a practical minimum. Adds hosts more quickly and remove host more slowly : 
threshold : 
Resource : CPU : 90% | 60%
 Memory : 80% | 60% 
 Storage : 70% | 20%
A is correct.

questions.question_text:
An administrator would like their VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC) cluster to scale down a host when CPU utilization drops below 60%
. Which Elastic DRS policy should be selected?
What is the maximum Gbps of bandwidth that each AWS Elastic Network Adapter (ENA) provides on a i3.metal host?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A all day

Selected Answer: A
A 25 Gbps is good

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

ESXi hosts are connected to an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) through Elastic Networking Adapter (ENA), which supports throughput up to 25 Gbps.
A - is correct
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
https://aws.amazon.com/vmware/features/

Selected Answer: C
Hybrid link mode requires AD. Creating the Users in AD, then assigning the groups in VMC to permissions needed. As soon as a user is deleted from AD, no more access.

Selected Answer: A
A - This is the only logical answer as B, C, & D all reference an On Prem vCenter via Hybrid Linked Mode or mention an On Prem SSO Domain vSphere.local
There is no mention of On Prem in the Question, only VMware Cloud on AWS - so this rules out B, C & D.

Selected Answer: A
No mention of on-prem in question, which rules out B & C since they both mention HLM. vmc.local is the domain structure for VMC. vsphere.local is an on-prem domain structure, which rules out D. A it is.
the question doesn't mention anything about an on-prem vcenter, I'm going with C

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
I am going with B
C makes it simple to remove the temp accounts

I think B is correct. See vCenter Single Sign-On from an On-Premises SDDC section at the link below.
https://blogs.vmware.com/cloud/2019/02/27/understanding-accounts-roles-privileges-vmware-cloud-aws/

choices.A: Log into vCenter in VMware Cloud on AWS with the CloudAdmin account. Create the required number of user accounts in the vmc.local SSO domain and assign the appropriate roles to the accounts.
choices.C: Create the required user accounts within Active Directory and assign them to the required group. With Hybrid Linked Mode enabled, assign the correct role in VMware Cloud on AWS to the Active Directory group that contains the user accounts.
choices.D: Log into vCenter in VMware Cloud on AWS with the CloudAdmin account. Create the required number of user accounts in the vsphere. local SSO domain and assign the appropriate roles to the accounts in Active Directory.
choices.B: Log into on-premises VMware vCenter. Create the required number of user accounts in the vsphere. local SSO domain and assign the appropriate roles to the accounts. Ensure that Hybrid Linked Mode is enabled to allow account propagation to the VMware Cloud on AWS SSO domain.

questions.question_text: To assist with seasonal workload demands over the next two months, a group of interns are hired to assist with day 2 virtual machine operations in VMware Cloud on AWS. Which method should be used for creating these temporary user accounts and assigning the appropriate permissions to them?
